heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 24 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: A significant rainy period is on-going and is ranked 7th for length since 23 September 2024.  So far, it has lasted 8 consecutive days beginning 18 October 2025.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (188°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the inside temperature (up 1.8°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 0.2 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 242 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.2 mm) and cloud levels (up 409 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 242.0m lower than yesterday, 41.2m lower than the past week, 409.5m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 794m and a peak of 2000m, averaging 955.2m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; cold temperatures are forecasted. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and winds will be practically absent. Showers, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.

washing.phrase: The current weather conditions are not suitable as it is raining.
